c74object.name: fl.tag~
c74object.digest: Tags vectors with tags either in order to set parameters or for routing purposes
c74object.description: Tag inputs each deal with one tag and take input vectors. The number of tag inputs can be set explicitly by parameter. Alternatively, it can be set implicitly by the tag parameters present at instantiation. A further input takes pre-tagged input to concatanated with other inputs after tagging. All inputs except the parameter input trigger output.

entry.name: /num_ins [int]
entry.description:
INSTANTIATION ONLYSets the number of inputs (and hence the number of tags).
(default: 1, clipped: 1-10)

entry.name: /empty [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the behaviour when empty frames are received:
[0] - ignore - empty frames are ignored.[1] - reset - empty frames create empty tags to reset parameters to defaults.
(default: ignore)

entry.name: /tag_01...10 [string]
entry.description: Sets the tag for input N [1-10].

objarg.name: [stream-specifier]
objarg.description: Optionally, the first argument may be used to explicitly specify the number of streams. This is done using a symbol starting with the character = followed by the required number of streams (without a space). For example, an argument of =4 will set the number of streams to 4.

objarg.name: tag_01...10
objarg.digest: Sets the tag for input N [1-10]
objarg.description:
Arguments set parameters tag_01...10:
Sets the tag for input N [1-10].

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.tag~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.tag~. When set to 0 fl.tag~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.tag~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
